amendment.description: To preserve and protect Social Security benefits of American workers, including those making minimum wage, and to help ensure greater Congressional oversight of the Social Security system by requiring that both Houses of Congress approve a totalization agreement before the agreement, giving foreign workers Social Security benefits, can go into effect.

action.text: Proposed amendment SA 153 withdrawn in Senate.

Amendment SA 153 proposed by Senator Enzi for Senator Ensign to Amendment SA 100. (consideration: CR S897-898; text: CR S898) To preserve and protect Social Security benefits of American workers, including those making minimum wage, and to help ensure greater Congressional oversight of the Social Security system by requiring that both Houses of Congress approve a totalization agreement before the agreement, giving foreign workers Social Security benefits, can go into effect.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 153 proposed by Senator Enzi for Senator Ensign to Amendment SA 100.
